page.title: 19CONSTANTINE FARMING YEAR
page.content: WINTER;In the winter at 8o'clock,the first thing to do would be to feed the ewes and lambs,then the cattle.If there was a milking herd this would have to be brought in and milked and fed .After this there are the odd jobs such as mending gates or hedges.Hourly checks the ewes if they are lambing .Noon is lunch time until 1.30.The afternoon is much the same until it is time to milk the cows and feed the lambs,ewes and cattle again. SPRING;During spring in the morning get machinery ready for cutting hedges,ploughing fields and spreading dung.You would have to muck out the cow house and pig house for muck spreading.4.30 to 5.00 finish work. SUMMER;In summer if the weather is fine you would mow the grass for hay and the corn if it was ripe,when the lambs are fat they go to market.
